thread.title: Kentucky, North Carolina Top Men's College Basketball Preseason Coaches Poll
thread.title_full: Kentucky, North Carolina Top Men's College Basketball Preseason Coaches Poll

author: Louis Milman
title: Kentucky, North Carolina Top Men's College Basketball Preseason Coaches Poll
text:
Share Article 
Tar_Heel_Rob/iStock/Thinkstock (NEW YORK) -- A pair of familiar faces sit atop the USA Today Men's Basketball Coaches poll, as the first rankings of the year were released Thursday.The University of Kentucky and University of North Carolina will share the top spot, garnering 749 points. North Carolina actually received more first place votes, 12, than Kentucky's 11. Other first place votes went to third-ranked University of Maryland (5), fourth-ranked Duke University (3), and fifth-ranked Kansas University (1).It is the third consecutive year that Kentucky has claimed at least a share of the top spot in the initial rankings. The rankings represent the first time there have been co-number one teams to begin the season since the coaches poll originated in 1991.The Big 12 and Big Ten each have five teams among the top 25, the most of any conference.
